snippet: The National Security Agency’s dominant role as the nation’s spy warehouse has prompted turf fights with other federal agencies that want to use its surveillance tools for their own investigations.
abstract: National Security Agency's dominant role as nation's spy warehouse has prompted turf fights with other federal agencies that want to use its surveillance tools for their own investigations; intelligence officials say they must be careful to limit use of NSA's troves of data and eavesdropping spyware for fear they could be misused in ways that violate Americans' privacy rights.

byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

lead_paragraph: The National Security Agency’s dominant role as the nation’s spy warehouse has prompted turf fights with other federal agencies that want to use its surveillance tools for their own investigations.

headline.main: Other Agencies Clamor for Data N.S.A. Compiles
headline.print_headline: Other Agencies Clamor for Data N.S.A. Compiles
